sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's Wednesday the 16th of February. Good morning Europe. Thank you for choosing to join us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.sentence: feel a glimmer of hope regarding the standoff with Russia over Ukraine. But a sceptical White House needed more convincing. President Joe Biden appeared on US television saying a Russian invasion of Ukraine was still possible and had a warning for Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, a day of unity has been called by Ukraine's president for a joint show of defiance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The meeting between Olaf Scholz and Vladimir Putin has been closely watched in Kiev with a firm message by Ukrainian authorities saying the probable recognition by Russia of the independence of the so-called Donetsk People's Republic and Luhansk People's Republic, the temporarily occupied territories in Ukraine, would mean a further violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And it would also be a big violation of the Minsk agreement that will make it harder to find this diplomatic and political solution to the current crisis. On Tuesday in Kiev, Ukraine's foreign minister also met his Italian counterpart Luigi Di Maio and after that meeting Dmitry Kuleba said that only Ukraine and NATO have a say when it comes to Kyiv's bid to join the alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Sasha Vakulina, Euronews, Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, NATO defence ministers are gathering in Brussels today and tomorrow

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: to discuss, above all, the ongoing tensions between Russia and Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Speaking ahead of the meeting, the NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said that this was the most serious security crisis that Europe had faced for decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He said the positive signals from Moscow that diplomacy should continue did pave the way for cautious optimism, but that NATO had still not seen any sign of de-escalation on the ground or received any positive response from Moscow on the proposals sent a few weeks ago after the NATO-Russia Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He added that everything was still in place for a new attack and that this would come at a very high price for Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And speaking ahead of the meeting today, US sources told the press that Allies were united on their stance and they were open to dialogue also with Russia at any time, any place or in any format and that it was still not clear what exactly was going on in the head of Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now NATO defence ministers will be deciding as well today whether or not to deploy battle groups to countries in the east like Bulgaria, Romania, Slovakia and Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament warned Russia already two times last year not to attack Ukraine and this time MEPs want to deliver the same message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In a case of a military aggression, Moscow might face huge economic sanctions. But the debate at the Chamber will also show how the different political groups' opinion differs on the issue of the sanctions. For example, the Socialists and Democrats think that actually strong action against Russia might backfire on the EU's economy. Also, far right and the far left groups are sceptical towards the EU's position, but most of the MEPs think that there will be some kind of compromise and actually the European Parliament will be able to show support and solidarity towards Ukraine in Sándor Zsíros, Euronews, Strasbourg.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Hollywood actor Alec Baldwin is being sued by the husband of the cinematographer Halina Hutchins, who was shot and killed on the set of the film Rust.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Baldwin and the film's producers face lawsuits of wrongful death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Lawyers for the family allege reckless conduct and cost-cutting measures led to the tragic accident. Baldwin's lawyers reject the claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: An out-of-court settlement has been reached by Prince Andrew in the civil sexual abuse case

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: brought against him by Virginia Dufresne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Miss Dufresne claims that the Duke of York sexually assaulted her on three occasions when she was 17, allegations he denies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Vincent McAvinny says the Duke's reputation is already damaged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is no appetite from charities or military organisations for his involvement again, and I think he will be someone who is now retired from public life, retired from royal duties, as much as he may want to perform them. It seems that not only the public, but also other members of his family don't want him involved. This has always been the plan of his older brother, Prince Charles, the king-in-waiting, to have a slimmed-down monarchy, to have a core group of six or seven, and that that will be the direct line from him, which will manage the affairs. And so this sort of plays into what Prince Charles wanted. And it seems that Prince Andrew will have to now accept that it was wrong what he did in the past two years. The interview that he gave on Newsnight that was so disastrous, saying he didn't regret the relationship, the bewildering answers that he gave about not sweating, about Pizza Express and Woking being his alibi. Well, many people tonight, although he has denied all allegations, will say, well, perhaps the proof is here. The fact that he has settled this means that he accepts that he has some responsibility for the whole affair and shouldn't be in public life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: responsibility for the whole affair and shouldn't be in public life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Liverpool trained on Tuesday ahead of the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie against Inter Milan. Jurgen Klopp's side won all six of their group stage matches to top Group B ahead of Atletico Madrid, Porto and AC Milan earlier this season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Inter finished second in Group D behind Real Madrid.

sentences.sentence: I believe Liverpool are the favourites but the matches must be played.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We must propose our game plan. I want our players to play with a free mind." It will be the first round of 16 match for Inter Milan in the Champions League in 10 years. Last time both teams played in European competition, Liverpool beat Inter 3-0 when they met at this same stage back in 2007-2008.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Bayern are one of the tournament favourites and have qualified for the knockout rounds for the 19th successive season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They eased their way into the last 16 as Group E winners, scoring 22 goals and conceding just three.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The first Austrian side in Champions League history to reach the knockout rounds were put through their paces by their young head coach Matthias Jeisle.
